definition:
The *Banach-Mazur metric* is a distance on the space of all Banach
spaces. If $B_1,B_2$ are $n$-dimensional Banach spaces, the distance
between them is
$$d(B_1,B_2)=\ln\inf \{\,{\lVert T\rVert}\cdot{\lVert T^{-1}\rVert} : T\in
GL(B_1,B_2)\,\}.$$ Then $d$ satisfies the triangle inequality, and
$d(B_1,B_2)=0$ if and only if $B_1$ and $B_2$ are isometric. The space
of isometry of $n$-dimensional Banach spaces under this metric is a
compact metric space, known as a *Banach-Mazur compactum*.
